channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Iswaran sends video message to migrant workers to tackle concerns
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Minister for Communications and Information S. Iswaran yesterday sent a video message to migrant workers to assuage the concerns of those living in dormitories who have been subjected to stringent measures and active testing amid the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: China donates 600,000 masks to Singapore's stockpile
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

China has donated 500,000 surgical masks and 100,000 KN95 masks to Singapore's national stockpile to help the latter manage the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Bill passed to allow marriage solemnisations to go virtual
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Couples whose plans to tie the knot were affected by the Covid-19 situation will be able to say their wedding vows via live video link, after Parliament passed a Bill yesterday.

item.title: Surge in Internet usage, but well within capacity
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Internet usage in Singapore remains well within network operators' capacity despite an increase in traffic since the start of the circuit breaker period due to telecommuting and home-based learning, said Communications and Information Minister S. Iswaran yesterday.

item.title: Personal alert button on trial for Tampines seniors
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Certain seniors living in Tampines are experiencing having their own personal alert button, as the Government ramps up efforts to protect the elderly who live alone and who might be more prone to falls or in need of assistance.

item.title: More getting ComCare aid and for longer period
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Social service offices (SSOs) approved 125 applications for ComCare Interim Assistance last month, up from the monthly average of 72 for the preceding six months.

item.title: 20-year-old nurse at Singapore Expo among 632 new cases
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

A 20-year-old nurse at the community care facility at Singapore Expo is among the 632 new coronavirus cases announced yesterday.

item.title: S'pore air quality improves amid reduced activities
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's air quality has improved as a result of reduced economic and social activities brought about by the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: 'Sovereign' woman charged with breaking Covid-19 rules
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman accused of not wearing a mask at Shunfu Mart near Upper Thomson Road amid the coronavirus outbreak was charged in the district court yesterday with one count of being a public nuisance and three counts of violating Covid-19 rules.

item.title: Four inspiring millennials get award
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Four millennials who have overcome various adversities in their lives - ranging from sexual abuse and cancer to mental health issues and taking up caregiver duties at 14 - and shown remarkable courage and resilience are the recipients of The Straits Times Generation Grit Award 2019.

item.title: Housewife was virus-free nine days before her death
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

The husband and three children of Ms Salha Mesbee - the youngest patient here to die from the coronavirus - gathered at her bedside in the intensive care unit (ICU) at Ng Teng Fong General Hospital just hours before her death.

item.title: Unis take admissions online, with focus on aptitude
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore may be stepping into a recession and jobs hard to come by, but that has not stopped young Singaporeans from making a beeline for university.

item.title: Stabbed NParks enforcement officer in stable condition after op
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

The safe distancing enforcement officer from the National Parks Board (NParks) who was stabbed while on duty is in a stable condition after undergoing surgery at Changi General Hospital, the board told The Straits Times yesterday.

item.title: New ID memo for those with dementia amid circuit breaker
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

The Alzheimer's Disease Association (ADA) is providing people with dementia and their caregivers with a letter that they can show enforcement officers or the police if they inadvertently violate circuit breaker measures in place here.

item.title: Rush for acupuncture treatments at TCM clinics as curbs ease
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Customers rushed back for acupuncture treatments at traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) clinics yesterday, the first day such treatments were allowed to resume since the start of circuit breaker measures on April 7.

item.title: Sisters lose suit against sisters over firms worth $120m
item.description:
May 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Two sisters failed in a court stand-off with their two other sisters to wind up companies worth more than $120 million that the quartet had inherited from their late father.

item.title: Singapore States Times ordered to correct post alleging students and teachers contracted coronavirus in schools
item.description:
May 06, 2020 12:20 AM

SINGAPORE - An online post that alleged that schools have been the source for infections for at least 50 students is false, said the Government as it invoked the fake news law against a Facebook page that suggested this.
